FAQ.question: What is the Goa ROR-1B (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: The Goa ROR-1B (Agriculture) is an official agricultural land record containing details such as ownership, cultivation status, tenancy, and mutation entries.

FAQ.question: Why is the Goa ROR-1B (Agriculture) important?
FAQ.answer: It serves as primary proof of ownership and cultivation rights, and is required for loans, subsidies, land transfer, and verification of agricultural land status.

FAQ.question: What details are included in the Goa ROR-1B (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: It includes owner name, survey number, land type, cultivation information, tenant or occupant details, tax records, and mutation history.

FAQ.question: Where can you obtain the Goa ROR-1B (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: It can be obtained from the Goa Revenue Department, Taluka offices, or through official online land record portals.

FAQ.question: How is the Goa ROR-1B (Agriculture) used?
FAQ.answer: It is used for agricultural loans, land transactions, subsidies, crop insurance, inheritance cases, and legal verification of agricultural land rights.
